intro: Unona fasciculata, commonly known as the African milk tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae and is characterized by its smooth, pale bark and compound leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by orange-red berries that contain a toxic seed. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has traditional uses in local medicine. The tree is also valued for its ability to thrive in arid conditions.
